title: Revert operation is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When comparing the Revert operation to the Close and Reopen operations in the Java editor, the Revert operation appears to take significantly longer.
OB: After opening an editor on the fileorg.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository, marking the file as dirty, and performing the Revert operation, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: This behavior is unexpected because reverting the file contents should not take more time than simply closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1) Open the Java editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java in the 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' source folder of the 'org.eclipse.swt' project in the open source repository.
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) Perform the Revert operation by selecting it from the pop-up menu in the editor.
4) Observe that it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the editor window with the original content.
